definitions.definition: Anything movable (a good) that is bought and sold.
Raw materials, agricultural and other primary products as objects of large-scale trading in specialized exchanges.
definitions.example: The price of crude oil is determined in continuous trading between professional players in World's many commodities exchanges.

definitions.definition: Undifferentiated goods characterized by a low profit margin, as distinguished from branded products.
definitions.example: Although they were once in the forefront of consumer electronics, the calculators have become a mere commodity.

definitions.definition: Anything which has both a use-value and an exchange-value.
